metadata.title: CVE-2020-12656 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** gss_mech_free in net/sunrpc/auth_gss/gss_mech_switch.c inthe rpcsec_gss_krb5 implementation in the Linux kernel through 5.6.10 lackscertain domain_release calls, leading to a memory leak. Note: This wasdisputed with the assertion that the issue does not grant any access notalready available. It is a problem that on unloading a specific kernelmodule some memory is leaked, but loading kernel modules is a privilegedoperation. A user could also write a kernel module to consume any amount ofmemory they like and load that replicating the effect of this bug.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12656` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-186-generic - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-4.4.0-186-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-4.4.0-186-lowlatency - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-4.4.0-186-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-4.4.0-186-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-4.4.0-186-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-4.4.0-186-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-186-generic - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-186-lowlatency - 4.4.0-186.216
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-115-generic - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-115-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-115-lowlatency - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-115-generic - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-115-lowlatency - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1077-kvm - 4.4.0-1077.84
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1111-aws - 4.4.0-1111.123
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1080-aws - 4.15.0-1080.84~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1093-azure - 4.15.0-1093.103~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1081-gcp - 4.15.0-1081.92~16.04.1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-186.216').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1077.84').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1111.123').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1080.84~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1093.103~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1081.92~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1051.55~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1136.145').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1140.148').
linux-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
